importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the current timeline of the conflict and the ongoing situation in Gaza, showing that recent developments have occurred in the past week.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period since the ceasefire began highlights the duration and effectiveness (or breakdown) of the truce, with Israel reportedly breaching it 80 times, indicating a fragile peace.

keyTakeAways: Israel has killed 97 Palestinians in Gaza since the ceasefire began.
Israel has breached the truce agreement 80 times, including 21 violations on Sunday.
The UN relief coordinator inspected the devastation in Gaza City, indicating the severe humanitarian impact of the conflict.

namedEntities.name: Israel
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation-state in the Middle East, involved in a conflict with Palestine.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Israel is the primary actor in the violence described, responsible for killing 97 Palestinians and breaching the ceasefire multiple times.

namedEntities.name: Gaza
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian territory under Israeli control, currently experiencing conflict and humanitarian crisis.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gaza is the location of the violence and casualties, and the site where the ceasefire breaches and humanitarian damage are occurring.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Government Media Office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An official body within Gaza responsible for issuing statements and reporting on events.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It reports on Israel's breaches of the ceasefire, providing official documentation of violations from the Gaza side.

namedEntities.name: United Nations (UN) relief coordinator
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A senior UN official responsible for overseeing humanitarian aid efforts.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The UN relief coordinator's inspection of Gaza City demonstrates the global humanitarian response to the devastation caused by the conflict.

namedEntities.name: Usaid Siddiqui
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: As the journalist, Usaid Siddiqui provides the source of the reporting and helps establish credibility and context of the information.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Since the start of a ceasefire, Israel has killed 97 Palestinians in Gaza and has repeatedly violated the truce agreement—reportedly 80 times overall, including 21 violations on Sunday—according to the Gaza Government Media Office. The UN relief coordinator visited Gaza City to assess the widespread devastation, underscoring the severe humanitarian crisis unfolding amid the ongoing conflict.
title: Israel kills 97 Palestinians in Gaza since start of ceasefire
